page.title: 01THE BORE HOLE.
page.content: WHEN BUTLINS FIRST CAME TO MINEHEAD THEY ASKED FOR 80,000 GALLONS OF WATER A DAY, AS BUTLINS GREW BIGGER THEY ASKED FOR 240,000 GALLONS PER DAY. THE SERVICES OF A GEOLOGIST AND A WATER DIVINOR WERE ASKED FOR; FIRST THEY FOUND WATER IN THE CAMP (UNDER THE WATER TOWERS). THEN THEY FOUND IT NEAR THE TOP OF NORTH HILL. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE WATER FELL AS RAIN ON THE HILLS OF SOUTH WALES AND PASSED UNDER THE BRISTOL CHANNEL BETWEEN TWO LAYERS OF NON-POROUS ROCK. THIS WATER IS STAGNANT AND HAS TO BE AERATED BEFORE IT CAN BE USED IN THE TOWN'S WATER SUPPLY. THIS IS DONE BY PASSING THE WATER THROUGH A NUMBER OF SIEVES. THE PUBLIC ANALYST HAS CONFIRMED THAT WATER HAS COME FROM WALES.
